# core.vectors.L2Norm { #optyx.core.vectors.L2Norm }

```python
core.vectors.L2Norm(vector)
```

L2 (Euclidean) norm of a vector: ||x|| = sqrt(x[0]^2 + x[1]^2 + ... + x[n-1]^2).

This is a scalar expression representing the Euclidean length.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type                                                                                                               | Description                        | Default    |
|--------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------|------------|
| vector | [VectorVariable](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorVariable`) \| [VectorExpression](`optyx.core.vectors.VectorExpression`) | The vector to compute the norm of. | _required_ |

## Example {.doc-section .doc-section-example}

>>> x = VectorVariable("x", 2)
>>> n = L2Norm(x)
>>> n.evaluate({"x[0]": 3, "x[1]": 4})
5.0
